Detailed Description

This is the network communication module for teleoperation of the Octarm.

An object of this class will initiate a separate thread, start a UDP server and listen for setpoints (setpoint_t structure in Octor.hpp) from the operator control unit.

Safety features:

  • If after connection from a client, no setpoint data is received within a timeout period (see timeout in global config file), the robot arm power will be disabled.

virtual void OA6NetTraGen::reset (  OA6 *  manip = 0  )  [virtual]
 

Resets the trajectory generator to current setpoint from manipulator, if specified; or resets setpoint to zeros if no manipulator is specified.

Implements OA6TraGen.

int OA6NetTraGen::readGlobalConfiguration (   )  [protected]
 

This function will search in the "OA6NetTraGen" section of the global configuration (See Octor::setGlobalConfigurationFile() ) for the following additional constants.

  • port - UDP server port. (default = 8000)
  • priority - priority (default = 20)
  • timeout - If after first connection from a client, no data is received in this period (secs), arm power will be disabled.
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
